### After-hours outlook for Friday, **July 25 2025**

* **No companies are scheduled to report earnings after the closing bell.**  
  Two independent calendars (Investing.com and MLQ.ai) show 30-plus releases **before the open** and **zero ‚Äúafter-market‚Äù releases** for 7/25/25. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/equities/after-hours?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [mlq.ai](https://mlq.ai/stocks/earnings-calendar/?from=2025-07-25&to=2025-07-25&utm_source=chatgpt.com))  

* Because of the empty docket, dealers expect a **quiet post-market tape**; any price moves are likely to be spill-over from the morning‚Äôs results rather than fresh earnings headlines.

#### Pre-bell results that could still echo after hours

| Company | Q2 headline | Regular-session reaction (so far) |
|---------|-------------|------------------------------------|
| Charter Communications (CHTR) | EPS $9.18 vs $9.58 est.; lost 417 k video subs | -18 % intraday ([barrons.com](https://www.barrons.com/articles/stock-movers-58f909d1?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) |
| Centene (CNC) | Surprise loss -$0.16 vs +$0.23 est.; revenue beat | +5 % intraday ([barrons.com](https://www.barrons.com/articles/stock-movers-58f909d1?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) |
| HCA, Aon, Phillips 66, Booz Allen, Saia, etc. | All reported before the bell and beat or narrowly missed forecasts; guidance updates will be watched for any late-day drift. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/equities/after-hours?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) |

#### Context: This week‚Äôs notable after-hours movers

* **Thu 7/24:** Intel (‚ñ≤ <1 %), Deckers (‚ñ≤ 6 %), Boston Beer (‚ñ≤ 6 %). ([swingtradebot.com](https://swingtradebot.com/news-articles/21979694-stocks-making-biggest-moves-after-hours?utm_source=chatgpt.com))  
* **Wed 7/23:** ServiceNow (‚ñ≤ 7 %), IBM (‚ñº 5 %), Chipotle (‚ñº 9 %), T-Mobile (‚ñ≤ 4 %). ([swingtradebot.com](https://swingtradebot.com/news-articles/21975337-stocks-making-biggest-moves-after-hours?utm_source=chatgpt.com))  

With no scheduled earnings releases after the close on July 25, traders looking for post-market action may instead focus on:

1. Follow-through moves in the names above after liquidity thins.
2. Any unscheduled corporate news or macro headlines.
3. Options-related flows into the weekend.

**ServiceNow ‚Äì key developments reported on the evening of July 25 2025**

‚Ä¢ Analyst coverage published today says ServiceNow‚Äôs ‚Äúbeat-and-raise‚Äù Q2 report is kicking off the ‚Äúsecond wave of AI spending,‚Äù with rising price-targets likely to pull shares higher through year-end. The MarketBeat note highlights 22 % subscription-revenue growth and strong large-deal momentum. ([marketbeat.com](https://www.marketbeat.com/originals/servicenow-the-2nd-wave-of-ai-spending-is-here/))  

‚Ä¢ The Futurum Group‚Äôs same-day analysis drills into the numbers: Q2 revenue $3.22 B (+22.5 % Y/Y), non-GAAP operating margin 29.5 %, cRPO $10.92 B (+24.5 %). Analysts call the quarter further proof that ServiceNow‚Äôs agentic-AI platform is ‚Äúcementing its position‚Äù as the enterprise AI leader. ([futurumgroup.com](https://futurumgroup.com/insights/servicenows-q2-2025-results-beat-expectations-as-ai-innovations-power-growth/))  

‚Ä¢ Press reports indicate the company has agreed to deepen its relationship with Google Cloud via a five-year, $1.2 billion cloud-services commitment‚Äîanother signal of growing scale and multi-cloud strategy. ([americanbazaaronline.com](https://americanbazaaronline.com/2025/07/25/google-cloud-and-servicenow-to-deepen-ties-in-1-2-billion-contract-465524/))  

‚Ä¢ These July 25 stories build on headlines from earlier in the week: ServiceNow‚Äôs July 23 earnings beat (EPS $4.09 vs $3.57 est.) ([cnbc.com](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/07/23/servicenow-now-q2-earnings-2025.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) and yesterday‚Äôs Axios report that internal AI deployments will trim ~$100 million of 2025 hiring costs. ([axios.com](https://www.axios.com/2025/07/24/artificial-intelligence-servicenow-hiring?utm_source=chatgpt.com))  

Bottom line: by Friday evening, coverage is focused on the strong Q2 results, fresh analyst upgrades, and a sizeable Google Cloud deal‚Äîall reinforcing the narrative that ServiceNow‚Äôs agentic-AI strategy is translating into both top-line growth and operating leverage.
